content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 3 to node 13 in the given graph is:

3 -> 9 -> 7 -> 12 -> 13

Note that this path follows the edge relationships specified in the graph. If you change the endpoint to be the previous point (e.g., node 7 instead of node 12), the new shortest path would be:

3 -> 9 -> 7 -> 7 -> 13

which is the original shortest path minus the last point.

The shortest path from node 3 to node 7 in the given graph is:

3 -> 9 -> 7

Note that this path follows the edge relationships specified in the graph. If you change the endpoint to be the previous point (e.g., node 9 instead of node 7), the new shortest path would be:

3 -> 9 -> 9 -> 7

which is the original shortest path minus the last point.
